title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeaturesGUI collection Shiny applications provide graphical user interfaces analysis MS-based proteomics data using Bioconductor ecosystem. builds functionality QFeatures scp package (Vanderaa Gatto (2021)), offering user-friendly tools bulk single-cell proteomics (SCP) data analysis. suite leverages power Shiny shinydashboardPlus deliver interactive, modular applications. Rather single monolithic app, QFeaturesGUI composed multiple applications, dedicated specific aspect proteomics data analysis. applications documented separate vignettes, making easy users navigate find information relevant needs. Currently available applications include: Data import Data processing Additional applications added future releases.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeaturesGUI serves graphical interface core Bioconductor data infrastructures proteomics. use GUI applications effectively, recommended understand underlying packages handle proteomics data. section provides brief overview; refer respective package documentations detailed information.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeatures package data framework specifically designed manipulate process MS-based quantitative proteomics data, primary focus bulk proteomics workflows (Gatto (2020)). preserves relationships different levels information, peptide spectrum match (PSM) data, peptide data, protein data. Additionally, QFeatures package provides interface various utility functions streamline common MS data processing tasks. details MS data analysis tools, refer RforMassSpectrometry project.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: scp package extends QFeatures support single-cell proteomics (SCP) data analysis (Vanderaa Gatto (2021)). operates specialized data structure wraps QFeatures objects around SingleCellExperiment objects (Amezquita et al. (2020)). data structure can conceptualized Matryoshka dolls, SingleCellExperiment objects smaller dolls contained within larger QFeatures object. SingleCellExperiment class provides dedicated framework single-cell data, acting interface cutting-edge methods processing, visualizing, analyzing single-cell data. combining SingleCellExperiment QFeatures, scp package enables principled handling SCP-specific challenges maintaining compatibility broader MS-based proteomics ecosystem.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: diving proteomics data analysis using QFeaturesGUI, important note applications act interfaces underlying QFeatures scp packages. errors occur analysis, QFeaturesGUI reports corresponding error messages dropdown menu top right application interface. messages originate underlying package functions. Users therefore encouraged consult documentation associated QFeatures scp functions identify resolve issues. error messages provide valuable clues, searching package documentation often help users troubleshoot effectively.

title: QFeaturesGUI
code: # Check if remotes is installed. Otherwise install it. if (!require("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("remotes") } # Install the package remotes::install_github("UCLouvain-CBIO/QFeaturesGUI") # Load the package library(QFeaturesGUI)

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeaturesGUI composed multiple Shiny applications, dedicated specific step proteomics data analysis workflow. Applications launched independently, depending task performed. example, application dedicated importing data QFeatures object can launched follows: Similarly, application dedicated data processing can launched using:
code: app <- importQFeatures()  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app) } app <- processQFeatures(qfeaturesObject)  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app) }

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: Rather single application multiple sections, QFeaturesGUI provides set dedicated applications. application addresses one step proteomics workflow exposes functionality focused graphical interface. use application described corresponding vignette: Data import: importQFeatures See importQFeatures vignette Data processing: processQFeatures See processQFeatures vignette Additional applications introduced future releases documented vignettes.

title: importQFeatures App
text: first step create QFeatures object provide two tables: Input Table: input table generated identification quantification MS spectra pre-processing software MaxQuant, ProteomeDiscoverer MSFragger . Sample Table: sample table contains experimental design generated researcher. rows sample table correspond sample experiment columns correspond available annotations sample. information tables can found documentation function readSCP scp package. provide Input Table, use Input Table box (red box ). Press Browse… button (orange box) choose appropriate .csv .tsv file computer. file sectioned, path visible next Browse… button. look Parameters section (purple box). Choose appropriate options import file (see read.table documentation information): separator character (default = “,”) decimal character (default = “.”) comment character (default = “#”) number lines skip reading file (default = 0) strings factor (default = FALSE) options selected file, click Import button. table now visible Preview box (green box), make sure well formatted continuing. process import Sample Table identical, time use Sample Table box (red box B).

title: importQFeatures App
text: QFeatures converter tool available right side application QFeatures Converter box (red box C). first step perform QFeatures conversion define columns used create links two tables. can done Parameters box (purple box): batch column: column Input table Sample table contains batch names. channel column: column Sample table contains column names quantitative data Input table Sample table correctly imported, column names available drop-list. Select drop-list appropriate column. option remove batch columns contains missing values also available using checkbox. information parameters can found readSCP documentation everything correctly setup, press Convert QFeatures object button.

title: importQFeatures App
text: QFeatures Preview panel now visible Preview QFeatures box (green box). Check preview conversion process went fine. clicking row (corresponding assay), selected assay appear , check everything looks expected. everything looks fine, can continue analysis using QFeaturesGUI (QFeatures object available sections app) download QFeatures use R. download click Download button, download .rds file containing QFeatures object computer. Choose destination folder, name file click save. QFeatures object now available computer, can used combination scp package continue data processing.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeaturesGUI collection Shiny applications provide graphical user interfaces MS-based proteomics data analysis using Bioconductor ecosystem. supports bulk single-cell proteomics (SCP) workflows builds QFeatures scp packages. Rather single application, QFeaturesGUI composed multiple apps, dedicated specific step proteomics data analysis workflow.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: Graphical interfaces MS-based proteomics data analysis Support bulk single-cell proteomics Native integration QFeatures scp Modular design task-specific applications Built using Shiny shinydashboardPlus

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: Currently available applications include: Data import (importQFeatures) Import quantitative proteomics data QFeatures objects Data processing (processQFeatures) Perform common data processing steps QFeatures scp objects Additional applications added future releases.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: Package website: https://uclouvain-cbio.github.io/QFeaturesGUI/ Getting started: vignette(“QFeaturesGUI”) Data import app: vignette(“importQFeatures”) Data processing app: vignette(“processQFeatures”)

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: QFeaturesGUI builds upon integrates several Bioconductor packages projects MS-based proteomics single-cell data analysis: QFeatures Data infrastructure MS-based quantitative proteomics. scp Extension QFeatures single-cell proteomics data analysis. RforMassSpectrometry collection R packages analysis interpretation mass spectrometry data. SingleCellExperiment Core Bioconductor data container single-cell data. SummarizedExperiment Provides general container high-throughput assays associated metadata. MultiAssayExperiment Infrastructure managing integrating multiple assays set samples.

title: QFeaturesGUI
text: Contributions QFeaturesGUI welcome. includes bug reports, feature requests, suggestions new applications improvements existing ones. Issues enhancement requests can submitted via GitHub issue tracker. reporting bugs, please include minimal reproducible example possible, along information R session package versions.

what: A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
title: A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
text: importQFeatures simple graphical interface import bulk single-cell proteomic data. app use readQFeatures function QFeatures package convert simple table (single multiple, csv tsv) QFeatures object. app allow convert tables QFeatures object.

title: A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
text: colData dataframe contains sample table. assayData dataframe contains input table. maxSize integer change shiny.maxRequestSize value, value Mb.

title: A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
text: Return "importQFeatures" shiny app object.

title: A shiny app to import QFeatures objects. — importQFeatures
code: library(QFeaturesGUI)  data("sampleTable") data("inputTable") app <- importQFeatures(colData = sampleTable, assayData = inputTable, maxSize = 100)  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app) }

title: Example MaxQuant/SCoPE2 output — inputTable
text: dataset subset SCoPE2 dataset (version 2, Specht et al. 2019, BioRXiv). input file evidence_unfiltered.csv downloaded Google Drive repository. MaxQuant evidence file loaded data cleaned (renaming columns, removing duplicate fields,...).  MS runs selected scp1 dataset (see ?scp1) kept along blank run. data stored data.frame.

what: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
title: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
text: processQFeatures() launches interactive Shiny application allows users visually configure apply pre-processing workflows QFeatures object. input qfeatures can provided either -memory QFeatures object path .rds file containing one.

title: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
code: processQFeatures(   qfeatures,   initialSets = seq_along(qfeatures),   prefilledSteps = c("sample_filtering", "feature_filtering") )

title: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
text: qfeatures QFeatures object processed, character string specifying path .rds file containing QFeatures object. initialSets integer, logical, character vector specifying assays (feature sets) used starting point processing. Defaults assays qfeatures. prefilledSteps character vector specifying initial workflow steps display application launches. Steps must provided using internal identifiers (e.g. "sample_filtering", "feature_filtering", "normalisation").

title: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
text: processQFeatures shiny application.

title: Launch a Shiny application to process QFeatures objects — processQFeatures
text: application provides drag--drop workflow builder allows users select, order, configure processing steps filtering, normalization, transformation. configured workflow can applied selected assays.

rownames, sapply, saveRDS, table, tapply, unique, #>     unsplit, which.max, which.min #> Loading required package: S4Vectors #>  #> Attaching package: ‘S4Vectors’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:utils’: #>  #>     findMatches #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     I, expand.grid, unname #> Loading required package: IRanges #> Loading required package: Seqinfo #> Loading required package: Biobase #> Welcome to Bioconductor #>  #>     Vignettes contain introductory material; view with #>     'browseVignettes()'. To cite Bioconductor, see #>     'citation("Biobase")', and for packages 'citation("pkgname")'. #>  #> Attaching package: ‘Biobase’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:MatrixGenerics’: #>  #>     rowMedians #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:matrixStats’: #>  #>     anyMissing, rowMedians #>  #> Attaching package: ‘QFeatures’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     sweep library(QFeaturesGUI)  data("sampleTable") data("inputTable")  qfeatures <- readQFeatures(   inputTable,   colData = sampleTable,   runCol = "Raw.file" ) #> Checking arguments. #> Loading data as a 'SummarizedExperiment' object. #> Splitting data in runs. #> Formatting sample annotations (colData). #> Formatting data as a 'QFeatures' object.  app <- processQFeatures(   qfeatures,   initialSets = seq_along(qfeatures) )  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }
